body.p:
As mentioned above, the Markup grammar defines a mapping between a Markup document and an abstract syntax tree. The tree is built out of tagged elements and strings.
Markup was originally developed in Lisp where the obvious representation for a Markup document is as s-expressions, with each tree represented by a list whose first element is a symbol indicating the treeâ€™s tag. (:body (:h1 "This is a header") (:p "This is a paragraph") (:p "This is another paragraph with some" (:i "italic") " text in it."))
The abstract syntax tree is rooted in a single element whose tag is body. Its children are the elements described below.
